description: From Middle English ner-bi, neer by, equivalent to near +‎ by.

adjectives.description: nearby (comparative more nearby, superlative most nearby)

examples: He stopped at a nearby store for some groceries.

adverbs.description: nearby (comparative more nearby, superlative most nearby)

examples: I'm glad my friends live nearby where I can visit them.

entries.meaning: (finance) A futures contract, of a particular group, whose settlement date is the earliest.
examples: In each of these markets the nearbys are almost invariably at a discount — a discount that tends to widen in bull markets and narrow in bear markets.
